title: Religious diversity in North America in 2010 , by religion
summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The highest Religion Christians has 76.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Muslims.
min_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population and Muslims has the lowest Percentage of population.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The highest Religion Christians has 76.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Muslims.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The highest value at Religion Christians is 77.0x times more than the lowest value at Muslims.
The Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population, followed by Unaffiliated, and Jews. Down to the Religion Muslims which is the lowest.
Similar Percentage of population is found in Religion Muslims, Other religions, Hindus, and Buddhists.
The lowest value 1.0 at Muslims is almost 5.39 times smaller than the average value 14.29.
Summing up the values of all Religions, we get total 100.0.
